intro: Bromus armenus, commonly known as Armenian grass, is a perennial grass species native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils. The plant has slender,丛生 (tufted) growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Bromus armenus is often found in regions with moderate rainfall and well-drained soils.
